message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.CY, cs.HC 

This paper deals with the analysis of textual content from social media, specifically Twitter, to obtain insights about the general state of a large population of users. This falls under the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). The paper also uses affective word taxonomies to compute mood scores from text, which falls under the sub-category of Computation and Language (cs.CL). The analysis of temporal patterns of mood variation also involves statistical analysis, which falls under the sub-category of Statistics and Data Analysis (cs.SD). The paper also deals with the detection of circadian and seasonal rhythms in the mood of users, which falls under the sub-category of Cybernetics (cs.CY). Finally, the paper aims to address scientific questions from a diversity of disciplines, which falls under the sub-category of Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC).
